snippet: Because of what the Obama administration called “operational challenges,” most small companies that buy insurance through an exchange will offer workers just one option next year.
abstract: Obama administration is delaying parts of program intended to provide affordable health insurance to small businesses and their employees, major selling point for health care legislation; because of what administration calls 'operational challenges,' most small companies that buy insurance through an exchange will offer workers just one option.
lead_paragraph: Because of what the Obama administration called “operational challenges,” most small companies that buy insurance through an exchange will offer workers just one option next year.

headline.seo: Health Law Provision for Small Business Is Delayed
headline.main: Small Firms’ Offer of Plan Choices Under Health Law Delayed
headline.print_headline: U.S. Delays Health Law Provision Offering Small Businesses a Choice of Plans

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
